details: The "Marriage Assistance'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Karnataka, is a welfare scheme that provides financial support to registered construction workers for the marriage expenses of their own or their two (2) dependent children's marriages.
benefits: Financial Assistance: ₹60,000/- for the worker's own marriage or their two (2) dependent children's marriages.
eligibility: The applicant should be a Building/ Construction Worker (Unorganised Worker).
The applicant should be a minimum of 18 years of age.
The applicant should have engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year.
The applicant should be a registered construction worker Under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of Karnataka or a dependent child of the worker.
The membership with the Board should be at least one (1) year before the marriage.
The family can avail of this assistance only twice.
The son or daughter must be of legal age for marriage.
application_process: Online registration on the official Website of Karnataka Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (KBOCWWB).
Fill in all the mandatory details and upload the required documents.
Review the details and check the declaration box.
documents_required: Employment Certificate/90 Days Work Certificate (Form V(A)/V(B)/V(C)/V(D)).
Beneficiary/original Identity card (Issued by the board).
Marriage Certificate by Registrar of the marriage.
Affidavit if marriage is outside of Karnataka state.
